title: Introduction
body:
This is the ADAPT DEMO course.

Scroll down to see all the interactions.

_items.title: Tab item 1 title
_items.body: The Tab component in the Adapt framework provides an intuitive and organized way to present content in a tabbed interface.

_items.title: Tab item 2 title
_items.body: It allows you to divide your content into multiple tabs, where each tab represents a distinct category or section.

_items.title: Tab item 3 title
_items.body: Users can easily switch between tabs to access different sets of information or functionalities, improving the overall user experience and navigation.

_items.title: Tab item 4 title
_items.body: The Tab Navigation typically appears as a horizontal or vertical menu of clickable tabs

_items.title: Tab item 5 title
_items.body: Tab Content refers to the actual content or information that is displayed within each tab.

_items.title: Tab item 6 title
_items.body: Tab Content can include text, images, videos, forms, or any other relevant media.

title: Flex
instruction: Hover over the images to see the effect.

_items.title: Heading 1
_items.body: Flex title is a presentation component. It can work by clicking on the tabs or work on hover, it must be adjusted.

_items.title: Heading 2
_items.body: You can download this commponent from GitHub.

_items.title: Heading 3
_items.body: To add hover to this commponent you will need to add this peace of code onMouseOver={onMouseOver} to flex.jsx.

title: Cards
body: Cards are a presentation component that displays an image and text in a card format. Cards can be created in several ways and interacted with by clicking or hovering.
instruction: Hover over the cards to see the effect.

_items.body:
This is card 1.

It is a long established fact that a reader will be distracted by the readable content of a page when looking at its layout. The point of using Lorem Ipsum is that it has a more-or-less normal distribution of letters, as opposed to using 'Content here, content here',

title: Lottie Interactivity
body:
Adapt Lottie is a powerful and versatile component designed for the Adapt framework. It integrates the Lottie animation library, allowing you to add stunning animations to your web projects with ease. This component can be triggered based on various user interactions such as scroll, click, or hover, making it highly interactive and engaging.

With Adapt Lottie, you can create captivating visual experiences that enhance user engagement and bring your web pages to life. Whether you want to showcase a product, convey a message, or simply add a touch of interactivity, this component provides a seamless way to integrate Lottie animations into your Adapt projects.

To access Lottie animations, visit the official Lottie site at https://lottiefiles.com/. Additionally, you have the option to create custom animations using Adobe After Effects in conjunction with the Bodymovin plugin.

title: Narrative
instruction: To access additional content, select either the arrows or titles.
mobileInstruction: This is optional instruction text that will be shown when viewed on mobile.

_items.title: Narrative Text
_items.body: The Narrative Text component in the Adapt framework allows you to present textual information in a narrative format.

_items.title: Narrative images
_items.body: Combining text and images, you can create a more engaging and immersive narrative that captures the user's attention and aids in comprehension.

_items.title: Narrative responsivness
_items.body: If viewing on desktop or tablet, this text will appear to the right of the image. On mobile, you’ll need to select the plus icon to reveal this text.

_items.text: Hey, have you seen the new Talk Items component in Adapt? I think it's a great addition for simulating conversations.
Yes, I've heard about it! It seems like a useful feature. I'm curious, how does it work exactly?

Well, the Talk Items component allows you to create a variety of conversation scenarios between different characters. You can define multiple talk items, which are basically different options or prompts for the characters to respond to.
I'm excited to give it a try. It seems like a valuable addition to the Adapt framework. Thanks for sharing this information.
You're welcome! Let me know if you need any help getting started with Talk Items. I am here to assist you.

title: Graphic compare component
instruction: Click on the image to compare two images or drag the slider button.

_items.body: The Vertical component is prestation component in the Adapt framework.
The Vertical Timeline component allows you to visually represent a series of events or milestones in a vertical layout.
It is an effective way to present a chronological sequence of events, such as a project timeline, historical events.
The Vertical Timeline displays events vertically along a line, with each event represented as a point or marker

_loopStyleComment.allPages: loop sequentially through all pages in course
_loopStyleComment.siblings: loop sequentially through all pages in current parent object
_loopStyleComment.none: disable previous and next buttons at start and end of the pages in the current parent object

title: Adapt Assessment
body:
Find out more about the assessment functionality, including an improved results feature. In this Adapt assessment, you have feedback for every try, a button for reviewing questions, and certificate.
The animated background uses Lottie. To access Lottie animations, visit the official Lottie site at https://lottiefiles.com/.

title: Assessment instructions
body:
Please read the instructions below before you begin the assessment.
  • You have 4 question to answer
  • If you don’t get it right the first time, you have 2 more attempts.
  • Your milestone is at 80%. You can do this!
  • Celebrate your achievement by downloading the certificate from the portal.

title: To scroll or not to scroll?
displayTitle: To scroll or not to scroll?
body: Can you identify a few of the benefits that a vertical scrolling approach offers over the traditional back and next approach?
instruction: Choose one option and select Submit.

_items.text: Scrolling is common [] on the web and therefore familiar to the learner
Scrolling [] the need for unnecessary navigation as pages can be as long (or as short) as they need to be
Scrolling [] ensure designs are more mobile friendly

_submit.ariaLabel: Select here to submit your answer.

title: Do you know your plugins?
body: Which of the following are types of Adapt plugins?
instruction: Choose true or false and select Submit.

_submit.ariaLabel: Select here to submit your answer.

title: It’s as simple as A, B, C
displayTitle: It’s as simple as A, B, C
body:
Can you identify the missing word in the following sequence?
Article / ..... / Component.
instruction: Choose an option and select Submit.

title: Content Objects
body: What would you be referring to when describing a Content Object within Adapt?
instruction: Choose one or more options and select Submit.

title: Results
_comment: use {{score}}, {{maxScore}} and {{scoreAsPercent}} to display score and percentage

multipleFeedback.1:
In your first try you scored {{scoreAsPercent}}% and have not successfully passed the assessment.

Retake the assessment by selecting the Retake Assessment button.
multipleFeedback.2:
Sorry, you have not achieved the passing score of 80% or more in any of your attempts.

Review your answers by selecting the Review Assessment button. Pay attention to the areas where you did not answer correctly

_bands.feedback: Congratulations! You have successfully passed the assessment with a score of {{scoreAsPercent}}%.

body: Select Close to exit the assessment.
